thread.title: Carlo Ancelotti reaches 1,000 games as manager - and gets a deliciously odd present to celebrate
thread.title_full: Carlo Ancelotti reaches 1,000 games as manager - and gets a deliciously odd present to celebrate

author: Jon Moody
title: Carlo Ancelotti reaches 1,000 games as manager - and gets a deliciously odd present to celebrate
text:
" , thanks for that..." (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) Share Get     
What do you get a man who's just reached 1,000 games as a football manager? 
Actually, let us make that question a bit tougher. What do you get a man who's just reached 1,000 games as a football manager - and who has also won three league titles, three Champions Leagues and three domestic cup competitions? 
In short, what would you get Carlo Ancelotti for reaching that milestone? 
A cake? Too boring. A custom printed tea mug with a list of his achievements on? Too rubbish. A medal? He's got enough of those. What's he got? We can see ribbons so it must be good... (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
See, it's a tough one. But trust those efficient Germans to come up with something equal part thoughtful, creative - and tasty. 
To mark the Italian's huge achievement, the Bayern board must've consulted the city's best producers of salty beer house snacks - who produced a giant PRETZEL spelling out "1,000". (Photo: @BavarianFBWorks/Twitter) 
Although it looks good, we've got to admit it took few squints and stares to make out the numbers on the doughy treat. 
It certainly rivals this season's other novelty-sized edible gifts - notably Jurgen Klopp and his giant Cornish pasty. 
And with Bayern players on the pitch making the occasion with a 8-0 home win against Hamburg, Carlo can certainly kick back this evening and enjoy it with a beer or three. Cheers, Carlo!
